Campus Safety is prominent, active, friendly, visible, and always willing to help. Some students have complained that officers are quite quick to give out MIP's however, and that they are constantly looking to bust parties.

The Transitional Links has a tradition in which students are encouraged to walk from the uncompleted side to the completed side. The Transitional Link is a large blue statue of sorts that looks like a house, and is big enough fro students to walk though. It's said that walking from the uncompleted side to completed side is symbolic of your time at Grand Valley; you come here as a uncompleted student in a sense, and leave as a completed student when you are done.

Professors learn your name and put personal investment in your learning. Class sizes are small, and really allows learning to grow. Also, there is a plethora of free help through-out campus, like free study groups, and free math, science, and English support centers. The university is consistently keeping up the grounds, and maintaining buildings, and even building several new ones! Educational opportunists are vast, and all of the programs are great.

The campus is extremely active, and there are hundreds of organizations to join and get involved in. Joining club sports, hanging out in Kirkhof, in the resturants, in your dorm, catching a movie on campus, and attending the sporting events and playing sports yourself are some of the many things to do on campus. Grand Valley is by itself in terms of location; the university is the university, not joined to any major cities. However; that being said, Grand Valley also has prominent visibility in neighboring downtown Grand Rapids, which is just a fifteen-minute bus ride.

Food is relatively good, although it can be a bit repetitive (seems to repeat on a calendar). The Connection on campus is by far one of the best places to eat on the Allendale Campus, as if offers more of a variety of food for students. Some of the older dining areas don't offer as much in terms of variety. The cafeteria at Fresh is great though, all you can eat for one meal, yes please!

Although it would be nice to have Air Conditioning units in the original dorms, dorm life is amazing! I have met my best friend there, and going in blind was the reason for it. I met many people on my floor who I still keep in touch with today (three years later).The stories and experiences I've had from my dorm won't soon leave me; they helped mold my college experience. The dorms are well kept, and the Resident Assistants are constantly visible, running programs to help keep students engaged and active in the community.

The professors do more than simply make you memorize a list of facts, and have you recite it verbatim back on an exam. The exams make you think, applying critical information learned from the semester to see what you have learned, and if you can apply the information you've learned into real-life situations. Requires dedication and studying! Take advantage of the free tutoring and study groups the Grand Valley has! It's a grade saver!

Study hard! Get involved! Although it may seem daunting going to college, take an opportunity to join one of the hundreds of organizations on campus, and really get to know people and your professors!

Grand Valley State University is consistently pushing the envelope, always making a path towards the future. Grand Valley puts the investment in its students, and you can see that in the professors, the new academic buildings, and the positive attitude on the campus (which is gorgeous). Grand Valley is simply amazing.

People will smile at you as you walk by and hold doors for you or help you up if you slip in the snow. There are tons of activities for students to do, from clubs and intramurals to watching the exceptional sports teams play, going to concerts and comedians, and watching theater. Am enjoying being here It was really easy to make friends at Grand Valley. Because of the large number of students, there is many different types of people. This with good food and lots of things to do make it a great place to be.
